title.narrative: Synodal route: participation and empowerment of indigenous women, Puerto Maldonado, Pucallpa, Lima

description.narrative: This project aims to strengthen the participation of indigenous Amazonian women from the Vicariates of Puerto Maldonado, Pucallpa, Jaen and the Shipibo indigenous community living in Cantagallo, Lima, to take action on issues relating to human rights, indigenous peoples rights, prevention of violence against women, and care of our common home, in dialogue with the Amazon synod. The project aims to support, through training and accompaniment, the creation of new female leaders, as well as to strengthen existing female leaders. This will enable them to defend their rights as women and representatives of indigenous peoples. It also aims to generate spaces for coordination and networking between Amazonian indigenous women and artists including via cultural and artistic exhibitions during the Bicentenary to make visible their voices, indigenous cosmovision of buen vivir in the context of the Amazon synod, and women's agendas. It builds on previous projects, which highlighted the need to increase the participation of indigenous women during the Amazon synod in light of their limited participation in communal spaces due to machista and discriminatory practices that have placed them in a secondary role with little space to express their opinions, participate and lead, despite the fact that women's participation is of utmost importance for the development, cultural revitalisation and future of their communities.
